title: Stock Markets In Green: Sensex Climbs 142 Points, Nifty Opens Higher
content: Indian equity markets started Thursday's session on a firm footing, tracking strength across Asian and US markets.

title: ‚ÄòCalculated move to undermine institution‚Äô: SC bans NCERT book with ‚Äòoffending chapter‚Äô on judiciary
content: The Supreme Court sharply criticized the NCERT for a Class 8 textbook chapter on the judiciary, calling it a "deep-rooted, well-planned conspiracy" to defame the institution. The court issued a show-cause notice to NCERT officials. Following the strong remarks, the NCERT withdrew the revised textbook and began retrieving sold copies.

title: Himachal vs Delhi cops: Major showdown over arrest of Youth Congress members ‚Äî how drama unfolded
content: A pre-dawn arrest operation in Rohru by Delhi Police for a protest-related FIR escalated into an inter-state clash. Himachal Pradesh Police intervened, citing procedural irregularities and a complaint of forcible detention and CCTV DVR seizure. After a legal battle, a transit remand was granted, but further detentions occurred, highlighting a jurisdictional dispute.

title: 'Living in la-la land': India slams Pakistan's 'incessant propaganda' at UN
content: India strongly rebuked Pakistan at the UN Human Rights Council, dismissing its allegations regarding Jammu and Kashmir as "incessant propaganda." New Delhi highlighted the region's development budget exceeding Pakistan's IMF bailout and pointed to infrastructure projects like the Chenab Rail Bridge as proof of progress, asserting that Kashmir is an integral part of India.

title: No room for error: Team India eyes big win vs Zimbabwe at Chepauk
content: India face a crucial T20 World Cup match against Zimbabwe, with their qualification hopes hinging on other results. Batting order changes are likely, potentially seeing Sanju Samson open. Coach Kotak acknowledges batting struggles but defends recent performances. Axar Patel's return is also expected as India aims to regain momentum on a potentially high-scoring Chepauk pitch.

title: Salesforce CEO at earnings call: AI does not mean we are dead
content: The US Defense Department has given AI firm Anthropic a deadline to ease usage restrictions on its models, threatening a $200 million contract loss. Anthropic, citing concerns over autonomous weapons and surveillance, has resisted. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged both sides have valid points, suggesting the dispute, while significant, isn't catastrophic for either party.

title: Tech start-up CEO says he‚Äôs being forced to leave Sweden amid product success
content: Indian entrepreneur Abhijith Nag Balasubramanya is stepping down as CEO of Hydro Space Sweden AB and leaving the country due to the Swedish Migration Agency's denial of his residency. He cited 'xenophobia and hostile' immigration policies, alleging gross incompetence and systemic hostility from the agency, which he claims forced him to sell his successful agri-tech startup.

title: DNPA Conclave 2026: AI, policy shifts and platform changes redrawing future of digital news
content: DNPA chairperson Mariam Mammen Mathew highlighted how AI and digital shifts are transforming news creation, distribution, and monetization. She stressed the importance of credible journalism anchoring technological advancements and DNPA's role in fostering collaboration and policy engagement to navigate these disruptions and ensure sustainable growth.

title: IND vs ZIM: India hope batters improve against off-spinners in must-win game
content: India's opening pair, Abhishek Sharma and Ishan Kishan, have struggled significantly in the T20 World Cup, averaging a dismal 6.8. Abhishek's poor form, marked by consecutive ducks, is a major concern, while the middle order also faces challenges against off-spin. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak remains confident in their ability to bounce back.

title: Trump to raise tariff to 15% or more for some; no hike for China
content: Greer said the Trump administration does not plan to raise tariffs on Chinese imports beyond their current levels, as President Donald Trump is expected to visit China in the coming weeks.

title: Elon Musk sends a ‚Äòkarma‚Äô message to Microsoft founder Bill Gates
content: Tech titans Elon Musk and Bill Gates are once again at odds, with Musk's recent "Karma is real" comment fueling their ongoing feud. The rift stems from Gates' reported $500 million bet against Tesla's stock, a move Musk publicly condemned.  Musk has also predicted Gates' bankruptcy if Tesla's value continues to soar.

title: Chiranjeevi, Allu Arjun, Ram Charan shape Tollywood; next gen set to rise
content: The Allu-Konidela family reigns supreme in Telugu cinema, a legacy built by comedian Allu Ramalingaiah and filmmaker Allu Arvind. Megastar Chiranjeevi and his brother Pawan Kalyan, alongside their children like Ram Charan and Allu Arjun, continue this powerhouse dynasty. Their next generation is already making waves, ensuring the family's enduring influence.

title: Telangana senior sweepers earn Rs 2L a month, says chief secretary K Ramakrishna Rao
content: Telangana's monthly salary and pension bill has quadrupled to Rs 6,000 crore in a decade, with power utility chief engineers earning up to Rs 7 lakh and senior Class 4 employees around Rs 2 lakh. This surge, driven by successive pay revisions, has intensified competition for government jobs, despite the state's strong economic performance and revenue growth.

title: Jason Kelce Blasts ‚ÄòConfusing‚Äô Ref Calls at USA Gold Showdown
content: Jason Kelce voiced strong criticism of the officiating during the USA vs. Canada women's Olympic hockey final, despite Team USA's overtime victory. While celebrating the gold medal win and the men's team's subsequent triumph over Canada, Kelce expressed frustration with what he perceived as inconsistent calls throughout the intense gold medal game.

title: Bill Gates admits affairs but denies involvement in Epstein crimes
content: Bill Gates has admitted making a "huge mistake" in associating with Jeffrey Epstein, telling staff at his charity foundation that he had affairs with two Russian women but denying involvement in the disgraced financier's crimes. "It was a huge mistake to spend time with Epstein" and to also bring Gates Foundation executives into meetings with Epstein, he said.

title: Canada signals shift, says India not linked to violent crimes anymore
content: Canada now believes India is not linked to violent crimes on its soil, signaling a diplomatic thaw ahead of Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit. This shift follows months of strained ties and high-level security dialogue, with Ottawa confident alleged activities are no longer continuing. The visit aims to stabilize relations and expand cooperation in various sectors.

title: What Happened to Vince McMahon After WWE Exit? Investigations and Fallout
content: Vince McMahon, a titan of wrestling, faces legal battles including federal sex trafficking probes and SEC fines after exiting WWE.  Rumours swirl of a potential multi-billion dollar comeback bid, backed by Saudi investors, aiming to re-privatise the company.  Despite legal woes, his net worth remains substantial, and he's launched a new investment firm.

title: 'Yadav Ji ki...' doesn't defame community: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea to ban or alter the title of the film 'Yadav Ji ki Love Story'. Justices Nagarathna and Bhuyan found no negative portrayal of the Yadav community in the title, deeming the petitioner's concerns 'wholly unfounded'.

title: T20 World Cup: After the Ahmedabad blip, India have no room to slip up
content: India are up against an opposition - Zimbabwe - that already silenced a home crowd in the group stages when they beat Sri Lanka in Colombo, and Thursday presents them another opportunity to replicate that success at the noisy Chepauk. Both teams find themselves in a must-win situation and Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl didn't venture into the "dangerous" territory of silencing India in India.

title: Gangster ‚ÄòNaveen Boxer‚Äô claims responsibility for firing at Lawrence Bishnoi lawyer‚Äôs car
content: Delhi Police have registered a case after shots were fired at a car carrying a lawyer allegedly linked to gangster Lawrence Bishnoi. A social media post, purportedly from rival gangster Naveen Boxer, claimed responsibility, accusing the lawyer of acting as an informer and middleman. The attack, which saw four rounds fired, is under investigation with CCTV footage being analyzed.

title: 'Had arms, Molotov cocktails': Cuban forces engage gunmen on speedboat allegedly from US
content: Cuba reported its troops killed four individuals and wounded six others after a Florida-registered speedboat entered its waters and opened fire. The government claims the boat initiated the exchange, injuring a Cuban officer. Suspects detained stated their intent was terrorism, raising tensions between the US and Cuba.

title: Ex-YouTuber texts mother in Kuwait, hangs self at Hyderabad home
content: A 20-year-old student tragically died by suicide in Hyderabad, reportedly due to unrequited love. The undergraduate, who previously created content for a YouTube channel, was found hanging in her rented flat. Her mother revealed a prior suicide attempt and a three-year relationship with a software employee who allegedly rejected her advances.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly emotional ahead of wedding to Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have a lot of plans to make about their future together as they are all set to turn a new and the most exciting chapter of their lives. Amid this, it seems the billionaire pop star is struggling as she faces emotional turmoil over her involvement in Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni's legal drama, that has lasted over a year now.

title: AI protest fallout: 20 Delhi cops detained in Himachal, freed & stopped again
content: A jurisdictional dispute erupted after Shimla Police filed an FIR against Delhi Police personnel for allegedly abducting three Youth Congress members. The Delhi team was detained, released by a court, and then detained again, escalating tensions between the two state police forces.

title: 'Hum sath aage badh rahe hain': Netanyahu shares car ride with PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shared a car ride to a technology exhibition after Modi addressed the Knesset. Modi was honored with the "Speaker of the Knesset Medal" for strengthening bilateral ties. Netanyahu praised Modi's strong moral support following the October 7th Hamas attack.

title: Pakistan semi-final scenario: What Sri Lanka exit means for their chances
content: New Zealand's decisive win over Sri Lanka has eliminated the co-hosts from the T20 World Cup. This result, however, keeps Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive. The final qualification spot from Group 2 now hinges on the England versus New Zealand match, with Pakistan needing a significant victory in their final game to potentially advance.

title: Sai Pallavi's home & project: Actor prefers simple family spaces over luxury
content: Sai Pallavi, a humble actress with an estimated net worth of Rs 45-50 crore, prefers serene, family-oriented homes over lavish properties. Her main residence in Coimbatore reflects a traditional South Indian style, emphasizing comfort and nature. She also owns a peaceful retreat in Kotagiri, showcasing her connection to the environment and simple living.

title: Told to pay, BJP MLA Chaudhary Babulal‚Äôs son slaps Agra toll plaza employee
content: Son of Fatehpur Sikri MLA Chaudhary Babulal allegedly slapped a toll employee at Raybha toll plaza after being asked to pay the toll fee due to a missing FASTag. The incident, captured on CCTV, was reportedly resolved amicably with the toll worker declining to file a complaint. The MLA, however, alleged abusive behavior from the toll staff.

title: Toxic trade in Mumbai: Vendors caught applying rat poison to fruits in Malad
content: Two fruit vendors in Malad were arrested for applying rat poison to fruits, claiming it was to deter rodents. Citizens caught them in the act and alerted the police, leading to their apprehension and an FIR under the Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Spurs vs Raptors Injury Report: Who‚Äôs In, Out and Key Stats
content: San Antonio, riding a nine-game win streak, faces Toronto on February 25, 2026, as 7.5-point favorites.  The Spurs boast a strong record and historical dominance over the Raptors.  Toronto's chances hinge on Scottie Barnes' availability, with key players out for both sides due to G League assignments.  Wembanyama's presence looms large.

title: Los Angeles Lakers eye $131M Cavaliers star; Austin Reaves trade key?
content: Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly eyeing Cleveland Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen before the 2026 trade deadline. The proposed deal involves sending Austin Reaves and future draft picks to Cleveland. This move aims to bolster the Lakers' frontcourt with much-needed size and defense, while the Cavaliers could gain scoring and guard play.

title: NHL Trade Rumors: Oilers stuck with $7.2 million player after trade talks suddenly fall apart
content: The Edmonton Oilers explored trading Andrew Mangiapane to the Toronto Maple Leafs in a cap motivated move, but talks stalled due to lack of interest. Mangiapane‚Äôs reduced role and modest production have made him a likely trade candidate. With the NHL deadline approaching, Edmonton remains active in reshaping its roster for a stronger playoff push.

title: Patrick, Brittany Mahomes‚Äô $275M KC Current gain national spotlight after ESPN move
content: ESPN‚Äôs new programming shift and upcoming docuseries are set to boost visibility for the Kansas City Current, the NWSL club co-owned by Patrick and Brittany Mahomes. With Women‚Äôs Sports Sundays replacing a long-running broadcast slot and NWSL: The Final Third premiering soon, the move reflects growing demand for women‚Äôs sports and positions the Current for unprecedented national exposure.

title: Cigarettes after tax: The post-February crisis, & how smokers are reacting
content: India's recent steep cigarette tax hike has triggered immediate chaos, with prices soaring and supplies dwindling. Retailers are struggling, and consumers face inflated costs. This mirrors global trends where high taxes, without robust enforcement, fuel illicit trade and organized crime, potentially undermining public health goals and government revenue.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for Feb 26 - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles, Colgate-Palmolive (India), and JSW Steel are the top stock picks that Aakash K Hindocha, Deputy Vice President - WM Research of Nuvama Professional Clients Group has listed. He also shares his outlook for Nifty, and Bank Nifty for February 26, 2026:

title: 4 passengers of US speedboat shot dead by Cuban coast guard
content: Cuba's coastguard shot dead four people and injured six others travelling in a US-registered speedboat in an exchange of fire off the Cuban coast on Wednesday, the interior ministry in Havana said. As a coastguard vessel approached to identify the boat "shots were fired from the boat," injuring the commander of the Cuban vessel, the ministry added.

title: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza 15 runs away from making T20I history vs India
content: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza is on the verge of a historic T20I milestone, needing just 15 runs to become the first Zimbabwean to reach 3000 international runs. He aims to achieve this in their crucial Super Eight match against defending champions India.  This encounter is vital for both teams' semi-final aspirations in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

title: His grandfather gave British Rs 35k loan in 1917, now, MP man wants payback
content: A Sehore family is seeking to recover Rs 35,000 advanced by their grandfather to the British government in 1917. The prominent businessman's family claims the loan, made to the political agent in Bhopal, was never repaid. They are now exploring legal avenues to pursue this colonial-era financial claim against the United Kingdom.

title: PM Modi becomes first world leader to cross 100 million Instagram followers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has achieved a historic milestone. He is now the first world leader to surpass 100 million followers on Instagram. This achievement highlights his significant global digital reach. Modi's follower count far exceeds other prominent world leaders. His popularity continues to grow worldwide.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs $12K Louis Vuitton look stuns on date with Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's stunning Louis Vuitton look turned heads during a Los Angeles date night with Travis Kelce. While her fashion statement captivated fans, the appearance coincided with growing speculation about Kelce's NFL future. Chiefs management confirmed they are preparing for both his return and potential retirement after a challenging season.

title: India, Israel likely to ink MoU on tech transfer for Iron Dome, Iron Beam, advanced missiles
content: India and Israel are poised to sign a landmark defense agreement, focusing on technology transfer for advanced weapons systems. The deal aims to bolster India's missile defense capabilities with Israeli systems like Iron Dome and Iron Beam, enhancing its security against aerial threats and fortifying its borders.

content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . some return as bitter runners-ups, others as new minted gold medalists .
